results.title: The Best bits of the Late Show
results.creator_credit: Mark Gibson, D Generation, ABC-TV (Australia), Michael Hirsch and Joe Murray
results.brief_description: Here is your chance to be treated to some ‘Champagne comedy’ from the D-Generation team’s crowning Glory - The Late Show. Re-live these classic moments; Shitscared, Graham and the Colonel, Pissweak World, Ouchy Wouchy Heart, The Mr. Whippy Grand Prix, Things wogs won’t do, plus literally dozens more sketches. You’ll laugh ‘til you cry!

results.title: The Bessemer converter
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, Merton Park, Film Producers Guild and John Durst
results.brief_description: This film describes the structure and operation of the Bessemer Convertor for making steel. Shows the raw materials, explains the chemical reactions which occur in the convertor, and points out the difference between basic and acid convertors.

results.title: The Bespoke overcoat
results.brief_description: Fender has worked as a clerk for many years in the cold warehouse of Ranting & Co., and wants one of the warm sheepskin overcoats stacked around him. Ranting refuses, and Fender asks his friend Morry the tailor to make a coat for him. However, Fender is fired and dies of cold before the coat is finished. His troubled ghost returns to Morry, and persuades him to help him take what he feels is his due - a sheepskin coat from Ranting’s warehouse.

results.title: The Bergen International Festival
results.brief_description: Describes the international cultural festival held in Bergen, Norway each year. The festival, attended by people from all over the world, is dedicated to the memory of Edvard Grieg. Outdoor theatre, philharmonic orchestras, folk dancing displays, ballet, singing and painting are some of the attractions. Concerts are held in historic buildings all over the town. Birgit Nilsson sings and finally the Bergen Harmonia plays Grieg’s Concerto in A Minor.

results.title: The Belgian begonia
results.creator_credit: Genevieve Grandry and Belgian Ministry of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The cultivation of begonia tubers at Ghent for export showing the care with which they are planted and tended. Shows the flowers in colourful profusion in gardens, parks, and homes.

results.title: The Behaviour game
results.creator_credit: Lion Pacesetter Films, Barclays Bank and Ronald Spender
results.brief_description: Designed to show the contagious nature of both good and bad behavior. Opens with the proposition that innate courtesy has been the hallmark of the Englishman, then the scene shifts to one of riotous discourtesy. Ways of improving public and personnel relations are shown together with information on appropriate demeanor at work.

results.title: The Behaving brain
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
Can new computer techniques, such as brain imaging, detect whether a person is, or is likely to become, alcoholic, manic depressive or schizophrenic? Can transplanting healthy tissue into an ageing brain improve memory? In this program, Philip Zimbardo examines the structure of the brain and the scientific study of the brain - neuroscience. The scientists interviewed explain the biochemical reactions that determine our thoughts, feelings and actions.

results.title: The Beguiled
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Malpaso Productions and Don Siegel
results.brief_description: A wounded Union soldier is discovered by a young student from a crumbling Louisiana girls’ school during the Civil War. The academy takes their prize in and cares for him, and the cunning, mysterious soldier uses the all-female situation to coolly play off each of his captors to his own advantage. This carefully manuoevred sexual powderkeg finally explodes and the film spirals downwards into a pit of released repression and psychological horror. Stars Clint Eastwood and Geraldine Page. Based on the novel by Thomas Cullinan.

results.title: The Beginnings of the cinema
results.creator_credit: BFI and National Film Archive (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: This is a representative collection of short films made between 1896 and 1903, comprising: ‘A Train entering a station’ (from the first Lumiere program); ‘The Derby - on the road to Epsom’, R.W. Paul’s film of the 1896 Derby; ‘The Brighton fire’; ‘Panorama of Calcutta’; ‘The Vanishing lady’; ‘Pienture a L’envers’; ‘The Music eccentric’; ‘A Chess dispute’; and ‘The Miller and the sweep’.
